definition: place/location/spot/point/office/department/bureau/respect/classifier for locations or items of damage: spot, point
to reside/to live/to dwell/to be in/to be situated at/to stay/to get along with/to be in a position of/to deal with/to discipline/to punish

road/path/CL:條|条[tiao2],股[gu3]/principle/truth/morality/reason/skill/method/Dao (of Daoism)/to say/to speak/to talk/classifier for long thin things (rivers, cracks etc), barriers (walls, doors etc), questions (in an exam etc), commands, courses in a meal, steps in a process/(old) circuit (administrative division)

sentences.english: The essence of French savoir-vivre is simplicity.
sentences.chinese: 法國人的處世之道的實質就是淳樸。

sentences.english: “But you know both God and how he works, ” Jesus says.
sentences.chinese: “但是你既知道也知道他的處世之道，”耶穌說。

sentences.english: It is not only the best as a matter of priciple , but it is the path of peace and honor.
sentences.chinese: 這不僅是最好的處世之道，更能給帶來和睦和尊重。

sentences.english: I also got from them a moral code, and a sense of what it takes to live in a free society.
sentences.chinese: 我也繼承了他們的道德準則和自由社會的處世之道。

sentences.english: Jesus says worry is characteristic of people who don't know God and the way he works.
sentences.chinese: 耶穌說憂慮是不懂上帝和上帝的處世之道的人的性格。

sentences.english: He's too young to understand the ways of the world.
sentences.chinese: 他還太年輕，不懂得處世之道。

definition: of all virtues filial piety is most important (idiom)
to seek the cause in oneself rather than sb else
to hear but not react (idiom); to turn a deaf ear/to ignore deliberately
lit. opening a book is profitable (idiom); the benefits of education
to take an alternate route (idiom)/to find an alternative/to take a different approach/to blaze a new trail
to preserve a proper behavior in private life
